title: 100 Cardano animations non English
description: News & education about Cardano & blockchain should be available in native languages. However, The crypto world is English-speaking oriented

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal to make animations about Cardano across 10 languages. Its asking for a significant proportion of the challenge resources for what is essentially a Cardano marketing campaign. They discuss that they have already started something similar in African languages. It would be good to see some metrics for the success of that program before rolling out to more languages.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan itself is relatively simple to create numerous animations and translate them across 10 languages. What is missing is detail on the marketing plan. How will you get people to watch these? Perhaps a better proposal would be more limited in scope to prove the concept works and delivers on its goals, rather than just the delivery of content.
f6_assessments.q2: Progress on the delivery of the content of this proposal should be easy to audit. Success is another thing. The proposers state its hard to know if a YouTube channel will succeed, however they should have some goals against which their success can be measured. How many views and subscribers for each language for instance.
f6_assessments.reply: It is not a marketing campaign but an educational program which can not provide short term KPI's of success since first you need a whole lot of content available before you become an interesting resource. The African project is funded and needs to be deployed from now on, so how can you ask for results of something that is at the start of completion ? There is enough information given about the fact that the Cardano foundation and the onboarding of governement contracts will determine the timing of the future success of the programs. But if there is no improvement of internet access available in Africa and other developing countries then Cardano itself can never become the blockchain of the world. Education is a long term process, but since we need to start with the basics the content created will remain relevant for years to come. Once enough content is created you can start doing marketing towards language groups that are ready for it. But we are at step one of a long process, just like the development of Cardano itself took and takes years to complete. In 2017 there were no ( short term ) parameters of success to be shown for Cardano itself. With educational programs it is similar. Either you think that the whole world will suddenly speaks english on an expert level, or you acknowledge that education and content needs to be translated in order to reach mass adoption. We have our POC which can limit the cost / animation drastically, since we know no immediate ground breaking results can be expected short term. Education is a long term investment, not a Dapp wth clear MVP and short term success.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project intends to create ten introductory-level videos on Cardano-related topics: eight in European languages plus Japanese and Filipino.

This proposal directly addresses the F6: Multilingual Resources key metric: "make it easier for non-English speakers to build and grow the Cardano community in their local areas".
f6_assessments.q1:
The URLs and attached documents suggest the submitter has put considerable thought and effort into this proposal. 

The submitter has established themselves within the Cardano Langbassador community.

The submitter provides links to existing videos they produced in the past (https://safetyinnumbers.co/#/). 

The above evidence suggests the submitter has the knowledge, skills and community contacts to achieve the project goals.  

The project budget relies on estimates from the submitter's past experience, reasonable assumptions about the work required, and below-market rates for translation costs. The resulting budget seems a little optimistic but not excessively so.
f6_assessments.q2:
This project has clear, measurable and achievable goals: build ten videos using the resources described in the proposal. 

The submitter was transparent and open about progress for previous projects by publishing milestones and status on a public webpage. See: https://safetyinnumbers.notion.site/safetyinnumbers/050be754fdc24c55b8cb45ab04bacbbe?v=a6a1663b0ae644d7b9d8d1da13c13326

Given the above, I suspect the Cardano community will have few problems tracking the project progress and outcome.

f6_assessments.q0: After review , the title of the Project can be misleading as you currently have  100 Cardano animations for non English  (speaker) :-  How about changing your title  What is Cardano in your language - translated in language. This will pique the interest of the reader and the first video will layout the whole curriculum of 100 videos.  I like the use of animations as to add a new language by voice over.
f6_assessments.q1: Given that you have the experience with African continent languages, I am pretty sure that the plan that you laid out including timeline and budget should be attainable
f6_assessments.q2:
In addition to executing the plan, what would you consider this project to be a success?
have you gotten positive feedback from your previous fund 5 project?  any negatives.  Will you improve the animations for fund 6 or incorporate any constructive criticism? 
do you have a rating of videos to gauge the effectiveness of learning and adoption. 

Do you plan on providing more advance classes , if one is interested in developing its own community leaders in their own region.
